items.title: Jimmy Cliff, reggae legend and star of The Harder They Come, dead at 81
items.summary_auto: Jimmy Cliff, who was a presence at the birth of modern Jamaican music and helped spread the influence of reggae around the world through his albums and starring role in The Harder They Come, has died. He was 81.

items.title: Ukraine 'coalition of the willing' reportedly planning to meet after confusion, dissension over peace plan
items.summary_auto: The United States and Ukraine pressed on with talks in Switzerland on Monday to come up with a mutually acceptable peace plan, after agreeing to modify a U.S. proposal that Kyiv and its European allies saw as a Kremlin wish list.

items.title: After her study on trans athletes lost funding in the U.S., this Canadian researcher is starting over
items.summary_auto: Canadian-born researcher Joanna Harper has been studying the ways hormone therapy makes a difference in transgender athletes' performance for nearly two decades. Her most recent study, which she was working on in the United States, lost its funding bringing her back to Canada.

items.title: Pressure on renters higher in N.S. than any other province, analysis finds
items.summary_auto: A new tool created by real estate firm Turner Drake & Partners blends multiple indicators of housing markets across Canada to assign scores to be used for comparison. It shows the financial burden on renters in Nova Scotia is greater than in any other province.

items.title: Demand soars at Halifax Diaper Bank 3 months after launch
items.summary_auto: A grassroots effort by a Halifax woman to donate diapers to families in need has helped hundreds of people in just the first three months in operation.

items.title: Suicide bombers kill 3 at Pakistan paramilitary headquarters
items.summary_auto: Three suicide bombers targeted the headquarters of a Pakistani paramilitary force on Monday, killing three personnel and wounding at least five, authorities said.

items.title: A St. John's soldier killed in France 108 years ago has caught the attention of historians
items.summary_auto: Researchers believe remains found in northern France may be those of a soldier from St. John's, but a family mystery is hindering the identification process.

items.title: Uh oh. The dreaded polar vortex may be making an appearance very soon
items.summary_auto: In 2014, the term “polar vortex” burst on the scene across Canada and the U.S. as temperatures plunged. In some places, it was colder than it was on Mars. Well, get ready to hear more about it.

items.title: The hunt for alleged cocaine kingpin Ryan Wedding
items.summary_auto: At a press conference last week U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi laid out fresh allegations against Ryan Wedding, a 44-year-old Canadian and former Olympian who has been on the FBI’s most wanted list since March. Wedding is already accused of orchestrating multiple murders, and these new charges add to the drug and conspiracy allegations he’s facing. We speak to Calvi Leon, a reporter at the Toronto Star who’s been covering this case extensively.

items.title: Critics call on Ford government to begin mandatory Ontario Greenbelt review
items.summary_auto: A mandatory review of the Greenbelt that was to have started earlier this year has yet to begin, and critics are demanding “substantive guardrails” around the Ford government’s assessment of the protected lands.

items.title: Younger-skewing co-op programs aim to spark teen interest in health care
items.summary_auto: Co-op programs in health-care spaces regularly enlist post-secondary students, but some are skewing younger to target high schoolers. The hope is to spark interest in a broader pool of teens, especially those from under-represented groups, and get more of them thinking about Canada's health-care system.

items.title: Booking.com cancelled woman's $4K hotel reservation, then offered her same rooms for $17K
items.summary_auto: When an Ontario woman made a $4,300 hotel reservation on Booking.com, she never expected the website would cancel it, then offer her the same accommodations for quadruple the price. A digital rights lawyer says such cases show how weak consumer protections allow online platforms to shift risk and costs onto travellers.

items.title: How the provincial takeover of an Ontario school board 13 years ago played out
items.summary_auto: Ontario’s new law meant to make it easier for the province to take control of school boards it deems “fall off the rails,” isn’t a new thing in the Windsor-area.

items.title: Search intensifies for grizzlies that attacked B.C. school group
items.summary_auto: As B.C. conservation officers continued to search for the three grizzlies involved in Thursday’s attack on an elementary school group in Bella Coola, residents say the incident reflects years of rising bear encounters in the remote Central Coast community.

items.title: Bear encounters on the rise in B.C. community where grizzlies attacked school group, residents say
items.summary_auto: As B.C. conservation officers continued to search for the three grizzlies involved in Thursday’s attack on an elementary school group in Bella Coola, residents say the incident reflects years of rising bear encounters in the remote Central Coast community.

items.title: Protesters of Manitoba's 72-hour detox detention law warn vulnerable people could 'come out worse'
items.summary_auto: Advocates say the Manitoba government's plan to detain people intoxicated with long-lasting drugs like methamphetamine at a Winnipeg detox facility for up to 72 hours could put marginalized people at greater risk.

items.title: Vulnerable people could 'come out worse' after stay in Manitoba detox facility, advocate says
items.summary_auto: Advocates say the Manitoba government's plan to detain people intoxicated with long-lasting drugs like methamphetamine at a Winnipeg detox facility for up to 72 hours could put marginalized people at greater risk.

items.title: Dallas Wings win WNBA draft lottery for 2nd consecutive season; Toronto Tempo to pick 6th or 7th
items.summary_auto: The Dallas Wings won the WNBA draft lottery for the second consecutive season on Sunday night. The league is expanding to 15 teams this season with the addition of the Toronto Tempo and Portland Fire. The two teams will also pick sixth and seventh in the draft next April.

items.title: Black Friday deals arrive early with shoppers eager for deals
items.summary_auto: Inflation and economic uncertainty have many Canadian shoppers eager to take advantage of discounts and retailers looking to get people in the door by starting Black Friday sales early.

items.title: Yoplait Yop yogurt drinks recalled in Canada over plastic contamination fears
items.summary_auto: Many of Yoplait's yogurts have been pulled from Canadian shelves after the company shared fears over pieces of plastic in some products.
